title: Quito
summary: Quito (/ˈkiːtoʊ/; Spanish pronunciation: [ˈkito] (listen); Quechua: Kitu; formally San Francisco de Quito) is the capital of Ecuador, the closest capital city to the equator, and at an elevation of 2,850 m (9,350 ft) above sea level, the second-highest official capital city in the world.[2] It is located in the Guayllabamba river basin, on the eastern slopes of Pichincha,[3] an active stratovolcano in the Andes Mountains.
